'''Martin Samuelsen''' (born 17 April 1997) is a Norwegian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[FK Haugesund|Haugesund]], on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], and the [[Norway national football team|Norway national team]]. After long spells at the academies of [[SK Vard Haugesund|Vard Haugesund]] and [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and short trials at big clubs across Europe, Samuelsen signed for West Ham in June 2015. Samuelsen, a versatile player, can play both central and wide [[Midfielder|midfield]] positions as well as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]]. He went on loan at [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] for the majority of the [[2015–16 Peterborough United F.C. season|2015–16 season]].
Samuelsen has represented his country at youth level, earning caps at under-16, [[Norway national under-17 football team|under-17]], under-18 and [[Norway national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. In June 2016, he made his debut for the [[Norway national football team|Norway senior team]].
== Youth career == Having just turned 14, Samuelsen was playing for [[SK Vard Haugesund|Vard Haugesund]] at youth level when he reportedly attracted interest from clubs such as [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] and [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. A year later, he joined Manchester City where he spent three years at their academy, playing regular football for their [[Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academy|Elite Development Squad]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3132548/West-Ham-sign-former-Manchester-City-starlet-Martin-Samuelsen-two-year-deal.html|title=West Ham sign former Manchester City starlet Martin Samuelsen on two-year deal|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref>
== Professional career ==
=== West Ham United === After the transfer to West Ham United was announced on 20 June 2015, Samuelsen scored on his debut in a friendly at [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] three weeks later.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2015/July/11-July/Live-Petetborough-United-v-West-Ham-United|title=FT — Peterborough United 3–3 West Ham United|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|accessdate=23 July 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714102829/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2015/July/11-July/Live-Petetborough-United-v-West-Ham-United|archivedate=14 July 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his professional debut for the club five days later at the [[Boleyn Ground]] in a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] second qualifying round match against [[Birkirkara F.C.|Birkirkara]], replacing [[Morgan Amalfitano]] after 59 minutes.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33541179|title=West Ham United 1–0 Birkirkara FC|author=Neil Johnston|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=23 July 2015}}</ref> Samuelsen is contracted to the [[East London]] club until June 2020.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2016/august/23-august/samuelsen-pens-new-deal|title=Samuelsen pens new deal|accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref>
==== Peterborough United (loan) ==== On 24 November 2015, [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] announced the signing of Samuelsen on a one-month loan deal until 2 January.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34914271|title=Peterborough: Miles Addison and Martin Samuelsen sign|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 November 2015|accessdate=24 November 2015}}</ref> Samuelsen scored his first goal for Peterborough on 2 January 2016 in a 3–2 away win against [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]]. With the game at 2–2, he received the ball near the [[touch-line]] before weaving past several defenders and shooting past Sheffield goalkeeper [[George Long (footballer)|George Long]]. The manner of the goal drew comparisons with the playing style of [[Lionel Messi]].<ref name="Messi">{{cite news | url=http://www.peterboroughtoday.co.uk/sport/football/peterborough-united/posh-report-sheffield-united-2-peterborough-united-3-there-are-only-two-lionel-messis-1-7129883 | title=POSH REPORT: Sheffield United 2, Peterborough United 3: ‘There are only two Lionel Messis’ | work=Peterborough Today | date=2 January 2016 | accessdate=4 January 2016}}</ref> In January his loan was extended until the end of the 2015–16 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theposh.com/news/article/samuelsen-2884943.aspx|title=Samuelsen Extends Loan Stay|author=Phil Adlam|accessdate=22 April 2016}}</ref> Samuelsen returned to West Ham on 22 April 2016 to compete in the [[U21 Premier League Cup]] final which West Ham won over two legs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peterboroughtoday.co.uk/sport/football/posh/posh-latest-samuelsen-returns-to-hammers-1-7346048|title=POSH LATEST: Samuelsen returns to Hammers|accessdate=22 April 2016}}</ref>
==== Blackburn Rovers (loan) ==== On 25 August 2016, Samuelsen joined [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37186551| title=Blackburn Rovers sign West Ham United winger on loan| publisher=BBC Sport| date=25 August 2016| accessdate=25 August 2016}}</ref> On 22 November 2016, Samuelsen's loan at the club was cut short after a lack of playing time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rovers.co.uk//news/article/2016-17/martin-samuelsen-blackburn-rovers-west-ham-united-3429153.aspx|title=Samuelsen returns to West Ham|publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C.|accessdate=22 November 2016}}</ref>
==== Peterborough United (loan) ==== On 1 January 2017, Samuelsen returned to Peterborough United on loan until the end of the 2016–17 season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38484305|title=Martin Samuelsen: West Ham's Norway midfielder returns to Peterborough on loan|date=1 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=28 February 2017}}</ref>
==== Burton Albion (loan) ==== On 17 January 2018, Samuelsen joined [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on loan until the end of the 2017–18 season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42724469|title=Martin Samuelsen: Burton Albion sign West Ham United's Norway forward on loan|date=17 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref>
==== VVV-Venlo (loan) ==== In August 2018, Samuelsen joined [[VVV-Venlo]] in a season-long loan deal.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Samuelsen goes on season-long loan to VVV-Venlo | publisher = West Ham United F.C. | date = 25 July 2018 | accessdate = 25 July 2018 | url = https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/july/25-july/samuelsen-goes-season-long-loan-vvv-venlo}}</ref>
== International career == Samuelsen has represented [[Norway national football team|Norway's]] youth teams on numerous occasions throughout his youth career. On 25 March 2016, aged 18, Samuelsen made his debut for [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway U21s]] against [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands Under 21s]] in a 1–0 win. Three days later, he played again for the U21s this time against [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain Under 21s]] in a 1–0 defeat.
Following Norway's failure to qualify for [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]], Samuelsen was picked for the [[Norway national football team|Norway national team]] aged 19. He made his debut by coming off the bench in the 53rd minute replacing [[Pål André Helland]] in a 3–2 win over [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]]. Samuelsen won the free-kick that led to Norway's third goal just after coming on.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/norway-vs-iceland/353955|title=Norway 3–2 Iceland|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=1 June 2016}}</ref> Samuelsen scored his first goal for the national team in a 4–1 win against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37620415|title=Norway v San Marino|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=5 February 2018}}</ref>
